result.execSummary:
The defendant Rex Michael Shelton III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Rex Michael Shelton III is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Rex Michael Shelton III was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Impairment of Physical Condition

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Enroll and successfully complete the next Batterer's Group

Submit to AODA assessment within 30 days and comply with any recommendations.

timeConds.notes: DE to complete 100 hours of community service as approved by probation agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Jail term is with Huber and is to commence within 30 days. DE to report and sentence shall start by 4:00 pm on 09/06/19 also Court orders DE not to consume alcohol and stay to be lifted if DE fails to comply.

records.addlTxt: Employment letter to the court.

10:38 AM DA calls case and states appearances. Defendant Rex Michael Shelton in court with attorney Bryce Alan Schoenborn.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties acknowledge receipt of revocation packet, and waive its reading. Recommendations by DA. Comments by Atty Schoenborn. Comments by DE.  DA certifies Victim Rights Compliance. Summation by Court. 

Court imposes:

Ct. 2 
7 months jail, jail term is with Huber and is to commence within 30 days. DE to report and sentence shall start by 4:00 pm 09/6/19 also, Court orders DE not to consume alcohol and stay be lifted if DE fails to comply. 22 days of jail credit is given. 
Reimpose all monetary obligations with credit for payments made.

Appeal Rights Given
Days Credit Worksheet
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 7, 2019 at 10:00 am.
DNA Submission Form

11:32 am - DA calls case and states appearances and agreement reached.  Defendant Rex Michael Shelton appeared with attorney Christina M Writz.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE enters plea of NO CONTEST to Ct 2.  Court questions DE regarding the plea and plea questionnaire.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC.  On motion of DA, court dismisses Ct 1.  Court imposes:

Sentence withheld - 2 years probation
Conditions of probation
$350 fine
$200 DNAAS
$100 DOMAB
AODA and followthrough  
Enroll and successfully complete the next Batterer's Group
DE must submit an apology to victim/victims in way and manner to be determined by probation agent.
DE to complete 100 hours of community service as approved by probation agent.

DA certifies victims rights compliance
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 25, 2018 at 11:30 am.

10:19 am - DA calls case and states appearances. Defendant Rex Michael Shelton not in court.  Atty Writz appears.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Writz states status.  To be set for plea and sentencing at a future date.  Atty Writz speaks regarding jail time being served in Michigan.  Comments by Judge Madden.  Court has no problem with jail being served there.  Atty Writz to follow up. Adj 10:23.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

11:40 am - DA calls case and states appearances.  Defendant Rex Michael Shelton appeared with attorney Christina M Writz.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts.  Atty Writz states that she filed a paper waiver of preliminary exam in this case.  Court questions DE regarding waiver and accepts.  Bond to continue.
Arraignment on September 14, 2017 at 11:30 am.

10:03 am - DA calls case and states appearances Defendant Rex Michael Shelton not in court. Atty Writz appears. Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Writz has previously filed a waiver of prel form.  Court grants Atty Writz's motion to waive preliminary hearing.
of Preliminary Hearing
Preliminary hearing 6/9/17 at 10 am.

Defendant Rex Michael Shelton appeared in court. Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.    DE plans to retain an attorney.  Court gives DE another notice of right to atty.  Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.  Bond to continue.

10:03 am - Defendant Rex Michael Shelton appeared, in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls case and states appearances and possible charges.  DE next court date is 10/11/16 at 10 am.  Court gives DE a notice of right to attorney and victim witness intimidation form.  Court questions parties as to bond.  DA states bond recommendation.  Court grants DA 5 business days in which to file complaint.
